action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: The image shows a scenic view of a city skyline with numerous boats and sailboats in the water. A large airplane is flying overhead against a clear blue sky.

You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this picture and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your image first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the images to figure out whether they are the same. Each of us can ask 3 questions. Now start your short image description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else.
DESCRIPTION: A black cat is sleeping on a plaid bedspread with its head resting on a book titled "The Lord of the Rings" by J.R.R. Tolkien.

This is my DESCRIPTION: The image shows a scenic view of a city skyline with numerous boats and sailboats in the water. A large airplane is flying overhead against a clear blue sky.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any animals present in your image?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A black cat is sleeping on a plaid bedspread with its head resting on a book titled "The Lord of the Rings" by J.R.R. Tolkien.
QUESTION: Are there any animals present in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a book visible in your image?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is there a book visible in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a clear blue sky in your image?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is there a clear blue sky in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any boats or sailboats in your image?

ANSWER: Yes.
QUESTION: Are there any boats or sailboats in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a bedspread in your image?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is there a bedspread in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my image that may be different to your image. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a city skyline visible in your image?

ANSWER: No.
QUESTION: Is there a city skyline visible in your image? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your picture and the other picture described the same picture?  Write "DECISION: same image" if you think they are the same picture or "DECISION: different images" if you think they are different pictures. Do not add anything else.
